snippet: The parents of Rachel A. Dolezal, an N.A.A.C.P. leader in Spokane, Wash., say she is white, and her story has stirred a national debate about racial identity.
abstract: Rachel A Dolezal, president of Spokane, Wash, chapter of NAACP who many thought to be biracial, sparks fierce national debate on race identity when it is revealed that she was born to white parents; blacks and liberals accuse Dolezal of an offensive impersonation, part of long history in which whites appropriated black heritage when it suited them.
lead_paragraph: The parents of Rachel A. Dolezal, an N.A.A.C.P. leader in Spokane, Wash., say she is white, and her story has stirred a national debate about racial identity.

headline.main: Black or White? Woman’s Story Stirs Up a Furor
headline.print_headline: Black or White? Woman’s Story Sets Internet Alight

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
